content.question: Type of Electromagnetic Radiation Frequency Range (<math alttext="Hertz" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Hz</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) Energy Range (<math alttext="Joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>J</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) Ultraviolet <math alttext="7.5 times 10 to the power 14, to, 3 times 10 to the power 16" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>7.5</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>14</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>16</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="5 times 10 to the power negative 19, to, 2 times 10 to the power negative 17" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>19</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>17</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> Visible ? ? Infrared <math alttext="3 times 10 to the power 11, to, 4 times 10 to the power 14" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>11</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>14</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="2 times 10 to the power negative 22, to, 3 times 10 to the power negative 19" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>22</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>19</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> The frequency and energy ranges of photons in some parts of the electromagnetic spectrum are given in the table above. Which of the following could be the energy of a photon in the visible range?

choices.label: <math alttext="9 times 10 to the power negative 21, Joule" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>9</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>21</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>J</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="4 times 10 to the power negative 20, Joule" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>20</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>J</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="4 times 10 to the power negative 19, Joule" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>19</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>J</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="9 times 10 to the power negative 19, Joule" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>9</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>19</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>J</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="4 times 10 to the power negative 19, Joule" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>19</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>J</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
